respStmt.resp: Conversion to TEI based on earlier work for the ENRICH project (enrich@oucs.ox.ac.uk; http://tei.oucs.ox.ac.uk/ENRICH/)

msContents.summary: Fifteen fragments, mostly from Missals, Use of Sarum, and recovered from bindings. Arranged in order of the Adams numbers (see below); unnumbered leaves placed adjacent to those with which they seem to belong.

history.provenance: "From the collection assembled in the late nineteenth century by J. T. Adams", most leaves with a number near the middle of the top edge, and with a tick- or 's'-shaped mark in the top right corner.
Sotheby's, 2 Dec. 1997, lot 10, bought by Quaritch on behalf of the Bodleian.

recordHist.source: Draft description by Peter Kidd, late 1990s.

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: (list of rubrics for the Sundays after Pentecost)

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: (10th Sunday after Trinity to feria IV after the 11th Sunday, pr. Missale Sarum, cols. 489-94; (Adams no. 50; Sotheby's item 15).

supportDesc.collation: the last leaf of a quire catchword

layoutDesc.layout: written in two columns of 33 lines (the top lines trimmed away; there would originally have been approx 43 lines per col.)

decoDesc.decoNote: two-line blue initials with red penwork; blue paraphs

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: (two consecutive leaves, covering the 13th to 15th Sundays after Trinity, pr. Missale Sarum, cols. 497-505); fol. 3: no Adams no.; fol. 4: Adams no. 146; Sotheby's items 13-14).

decoDesc.decoNote: two-line blue initials with red penwork; blue paraphs

msItem.title: Book of Hours or Psalter
msItem.note: Ps. 118:7-24 (the recto has offsets of a border and initial [or miniature?] and thus probably comes from the Commendation of Souls]; (Adams no. 170; Sotheby's item 7).

decoDesc.decoNote: two two-line initials in gold, on red and blue grounds with white tracery, one-line initials and a paraph in gold with dark purple penwork

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: (part of the Mass for one Confessor, from the Common of Saints (pr. Missale Sarum, cols. 703*-706*) (Adams no. 200; Sotheby's item 4/5/6).
Fols. 6-8 may come from a single manuscript, but the script and thickness of the pen vary from one to the next.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubrics supplied but spaces for initials left blank

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: From the mass for a non-virgin martyr, to the mass for a many virgins, in the Common of Saints; and the start of a votive mass for the Trinity (pr. Missale Sarum, cols. 727*-9* and 735* (no Adams no.; Sotheby's item 4/5/6)
Fols. 6-8 may come from a single manuscript, but the script and thickness of the pen vary from one to the next.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubrics supplied but spaces for initials left blank

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: From the end of the Mass for St. Kenelm to that for St. Wandrille in the Sanctorale (pr. Missale Sarum, 814-8, ending with the reading on 731* for a non-Virgin) (no Adams no.; Sotheby's item 4/5/6).
Fols. 6-8 may come from a single manuscript, but the script and thickness of the pen vary from one to the next.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubrics supplied but spaces for initials left blank

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note:
Perhaps part of the Mass for the Dead or for the Nearly Dead (cf.
Missale Sarum, col. 814*). (Adams no. 222; Sotheby's item 2).

layoutDesc.layout: two columns of approx. 29 lines (trimmed at the top; only 23 lines extant)

decoDesc.decoNote: two-line and one-line initials alternately red or green

origin.origDate: late 12th cent., with 13th-cent. formal bookhand and 14th-cent. cursive additions

msItem.title: Breviary

decoDesc.decoNote: rubricated but with unfilled spaces for initials

history.provenance: Inscribed in a fine 16th-cent. italic hand 'Humfry Bouton. | Rumpatur quisque Rumpitur inuidia' [Martial, Epigrammata ix.97], and, in Italian in a very similar hand, 'Donna seguita prega quel qui' (?), and 'Que douj altij amor da speme nasce, | Dal non sperar in me(?) s'auuie et pasce.| [signed] J. [or I.] G.'
The verso inscribed in French(?), 18th(?)-cent., 'au(?) cat p 308'

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: Part of Tuesday in the fourth week of Lent (pr. Missale Sarum, cols. 217-219) (Adams no. 461; Sotheby's item 8)

decoDesc.decoNote: one gold two-line initial with blue penwork, others in blue with red penwork

msItem.title: Missal
msItem.note: Masses for the Assumption of the Virgin, St. Bartolomew, and John the Evangelist, with marginal near-contemporary addition of directions for the feast of St. Bernard (canonized 1174) (no Adams no.; Sotheby's item 1).

layoutDesc.layout: two(?) columns of 26 lines (only one col. extant)

decoDesc.decoNote: two-line initials in blue with red penwork
two-line initials in blue with red penwork

bibl.title: Corpus of British Medieval Library Catalogues

category.catDesc: Auctoritates, Compilationes, Dicta, Excerta, Excerptiones, Flores, Notabilia, Notabilitates, Sententiae
Commentarii, Conclusiones, Expositiones, Glosae, Lecturae, Notulae, Proemia, Quaestiones, Scholia, Scripta
